text: "Love Me" is a 1976 song by the Bee Gees. It was the seventh track from their 14th studio album Children of the World. ==Yvonne Elliman version== In 1976, Yvonne Elliman released a version of Love Me. It went to number 3 in New Zealand and South Africa, number 6 in the United Kingdom, number 9 in Ireland, number 11 in Canada, number 14 in the United States, number 15 in the Netherlands and number 16 in Australia. ==Martine McCutcheon version== In 1999, Martine McCutcheon covered Love Me for the 1999 BBC Children in Need and for her debut studio album You Me & Us. It was released with its A-side Talking in Your Sleep. It went to number 6 in the United Kingdom, number 10 in Scotland and number 26 in Ireland. ===Track listing=== # "Love Me" (radio mix)- 3:44 # "Talking in Your Sleep" (radio edit) - 4:06 == References == Category:1976 songs Category:Bee Gees songs Category:Yvonne Elliman songs Category:Martine McCutcheon songs Category:Soul songs
title: Love Me (Bee Gees song)
